required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Collagen Injections for the Treatment of Acne Scars and Wrinkles
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study of Autologous Fibroblast Injection for Acne Scars, Forehead Lines, Lip Lines, Horizontal Neck Lines, and Static Crow's Feet

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to find out if autologous (your own) fibroblast injections are effective for the treatment of acne scars and wrinkles.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Company stopped making product for cosmetic use. All consented subjects withdrew before any study interventions were performed.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of rater's comparisons at 6 months

arm_group.description: The fibroblast treatment will be randomly injected into one side of the face.
The vehicle will be injected randomly to the other side of the face.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18 or over
- Bilateral acne scars or have moderate to severe wrinkles
- Subjects in good health
- Subjects has the willingness and the ability to understand and provide informed consent for the use of their tissue and communicate with the investigator
Exclusion Criteria:
- Under 18 years of age
- Pregnancy or lactation
- recent Accutane use in the past 6 months
- prone to hypertrophic and keloidal scarring
- have excessively redundant skin in the treatment area or wrinkles longer than 20 cm total
- have a history of autoimmune disorders, organ transplantation, cancer not in remission, active or chronic skin disease
- have a history of basal-cell carcinoma
- have previously received autologous fibroblast treatment
- have undergone any confounding therapy in the lower two-thirds of the face within 1 year or any investigational treatment within 30 days.
- have an allergy to collagen, bovine products, local anesthetics, gentamicin, or amphotericin B
- subjects who are unable to understand the protocol or to give informed consent
- subjects with mental illness

facility.name: Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine, Department of Dermatology

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor in Dermatology, Otolaryngology- Head and Neck Surgery and Surgery-Organ Transplantation
